loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married and has three children. She operates a general store to make a living. She has been in the business for three years and has earned enough to meet her family's needs and to send her children to school. She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to sustain the business to ensure a better source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Luxmie

texts.en:
Luxmie is married with three children and along with her husband, make a living working on their farm.  She has been growing and harvesting bananas for many years, earning well for the family.  

Luxmie took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs for weeding maintenance.  She hopes to sustain and improve the farm to earn more income, and wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to cover costs for weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
To make a living, Mely owns and operates a banana farm in her village.  She has been helping her husband earn a good living for the family for six years.  Mely successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for farm inputs.  

Aside from banana farming, Mely has also engaged in a grocery goods business to earn extra income.  She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the grocery business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette makes a living by operating a general store in her village.  She has earned a good living for the past three years in the business, and is able to provide well for her family's needs.

Nanette took a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  She always find ways to augment her business and improve her quality of living. She wants to ensure a better income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: To make a living, Nora operates a general store in their village for seven years.  She earns well enough from this to provide for her family. She has also successfully repaid her previous loan, used for the business. She currently took a new loan to purchase additional groceries to sell. She used her generated revenue to improve their banana farm, their main source of income.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalin

texts.en:
Rosalin is married with three children. She has been earning a living making nipa. For three years in the business, she earns enough for the daily needs. She needs to improve their income to sustain their living and to cover other household expenses.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more palm leaves in order to cater orders and keep up with demand. Hopefully, in the future, she can have another business to augment their living situation.

loans.use: to buy more palm leaves.

loans.name: Joe Vannie

texts.en: Joe Vannie wants to have a better career in the future. He is studying for a B.S. of criminology at Sacred Heart College and is in his fourth year. His mother is earning an income from a cafeteria business and his father was an appliances technician. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC (Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative) microcredit to pay for school fees and miscellaneous expenses which he needs currently. He wants to improve the quality of living of his entire family and dreams to become successful.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and miscellaneous expenses.

loans.name: Arolyn

texts.en: Arolyn helps her husband in their fishing business to make a living. She has been in this business for three years and she earns enough for the family's daily needs. She joined GDMPC (Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative) and had borrowed a new loan to buy new fishing nets. She wants to gain more income to provide a better education for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Marianel

texts.en: Marianel, a widow with an only child, operates a general store to make a living. She has been in her business for four years and she earns a good amount for her family. She had joined GDMPC (Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative) in 2008 and recently took out a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the near future, she wants to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
To make a living, Maria Fe is running a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products in her village. She earns well from the business and has successfully repaid the previous loan, which was used for additional capital for the business. 

Maria Fe requested a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She is thankful to GDMPC for helping to improve her quality of living. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: To make a living, Jane has been operating a pig-fattening business for more than two years and earns a better income from this.  While waiting for her live-in partner who is working abroad, she had to earn an income for her daily needs. She joined GDMPC in 2013 and recently borrowed a new loan to buy feed and repair her livestock shelter. In the future, she wants to expand and improve her business because she finds a better income from this line of business.

loans.use: to buy feed and repair her livestock's shelter

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: To make a living, Carmen helps her husband in their fishing business. She sells fish in their village while her husband does fishing. She earns well from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used in the business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase new fishing nets to be used for fishing. Carmen wants to improve their house and dreams of sending her children to school to finish their studies for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: To make a living, Marilou operates a general store and earns well from this business. She has been selling different kinds of grocery goods in their village for many years. She has been able to provide the needs of the family and has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to improve the business. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. Improving the business is her passion because she wants to have a stable source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en: To make a living, Aurora sells specialty food products in their village and has been doing this for more than six years, earning well for the family's needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to purchase ingredients to prepare her food products. Aside from this, she has a rice farm, which is their main source of income. She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides. Improving the farm is her great dream because she wants to expand and ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: While waiting for her husband working abroad, Julieta operates a general store to make a living. She has been doing this business for more than three years, earning a good amount for the family's daily needs. She took a new loan from GDMPC (Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative) in order to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to expand her business to gain more income for a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: To make a living, Emma manages a buy-and-sell business of home appliances and gadgets earning well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for improving the business. Aside from this, Emma has a general store where she earns additional income for their living costs. She has taken out a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell to improve her store. Her passion for improving her business is wholehearted as it is dedicated to her family. She will use her profits for her children's education costs and needs.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Bennyfer

texts.en:
To make a living, Bennyfer operates a general store in his village in order to provide his family. He has been in the business for 10 years and he earns well from this. 

Bennyfer joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. Improving and expanding the business is his passion for he wants to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
To make a living, Virgilio has operated a fishing business for many years, earning well for the family. 

He has successfully repaid his previous loan, used for fishing equipment. 

Currently, Virgilio borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to purchase additional fishing nets. 

He wants to improve the general living situation of his family, and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: To make a living, Caroline manages an Internet cafe in town which includes video game entertainment, and she earns a good amount from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in repairing the unit. To expand the business, she took a new loan from GDMPC (Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative) microfinance to buy a new monitor used for games. She plans to expand her business and is hopeful that she can give better living conditions to her children in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a new monitor.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is studying for a Bachelor of Elementary Education degree at a university in Mindanao. She had a part-time income being a cosmetics dealer. She has two siblings who are still dependent on her parent.

She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to pay for school tuition fees for the second semester of this current school year. She is hopeful to have a better career in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Jia Unika

texts.en:
Jia Unika is studying for a degree in Business Administration at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City. Her father was a government employee and earned well, but she had four siblings, the reason for her financial difficulties. 

She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to pay for school tuition fees this semester. 

She is determined to finish her studies and get a better job in the future.

loans.use: to pay for school tuition fees this semester

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
To make a living, Benjamin manages his cafeteria selling meals in their village. He earns well from this so that he was able to provide the needs of the family.

To improve the business, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy raw ingredients and purchase new kitchenware to be used as food container and keepers. His passion is to improve his business and to provide a better living of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and purchase new kitchenware

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
To make a living, Mary Jane operates a fish vending business in their village. While her husband earns from his salary as a factory worker, she sells fish and earns well from this. 

She had joined GDMPC recently and had borrowed a loan to buy an additional variety of fish to sell. For ten years in the business, she has dreamed of owning a fishing boat which she has rented for many years. In the future, she plans to use her profit in making her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy an additional variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Frence Nhel

texts.en:
Frence Nhel is studying for a degree in Elementary Education at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City. He had three siblings, and his father works as a construction worker. Frence had part-time income from his tutorial work. 

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to pay for school tuition fees for the second semester this school year. 

He hopes to have a better career in the future to help his family augment their living situation.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
To make a living, Nelsie operates a general store in their village and has been doing this business for five years. She earns well from this, and was able to support her children's needs in school. 

She joined GDMPC and got a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. 

She plans to expand her business, and to improve it to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jovel

texts.en: To make a living, Jovel manages a banana production business. He earns well from this. For more than three years, he was able to provide for his family and has successfully repaid his previous loan used for farm inputs. Currently, he took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. He was determined to improve the farm to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en: To make a living, Carmencita helps her husband working in their own farm. For almost twenty years in growing and harvesting different types of crops, their living was sustained. To improve their income, the couple had to expand a banana farm. She joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance. She borrowed a loan to buy organic fertilizer and pay land preparation costs. She is hopeful to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay land preparation costs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a retail business in her village. For more than eleven years in the business, she has earned well to be able to provide for her family and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for additional inventory. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
To make a living, Carmelita helps her husband with managing their farm, and at the same time, operates a retail store in their village. She earns well from their farm and her business and was able to successfully repay her previous loan used in the business. 

She took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Finance to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the farm and expand her business to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: To make a living, Carmelita helps her husband manage their farm and at the same time operates a retail store in their village. She earns well from their farm and her business and was able to successfully repay her previous loan used in the business. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to purchase additional grocery goods to resell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the farm and expand her business to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo is married. They are both earning an income as government employees. Aside from earning a salary, he also has a rice farm, which is the main source of income. He joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a new loan to pay the tuition fees for the higher education of his children. Rodrigo wants to augment their living conditions and find his children successful in the near future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his children

loans.name: Cherlyn

texts.en:
To make a living, Cherlyn operates a service-based business in her community. She has been providing transportation for many years and she earns well in this business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for licenses. 

Being a member of GDMPC, has helped a lot in improving her family's quality of life. Currently, she took a new loan to buy a new set of tires. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family and wants to see her children be successful.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: To make a living, Loida helps her husband operate their own farm in their village. She has been growing and harvesting different types of crops for more than five years and she earns well for the family.  She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for fertilization of the farm. Currently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to cover the cost for weeding maintenance and to use a portion to purchase organic fertilizer.  She always finds ways to improve the farm and sustain a greener field to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to cover the cost for weeding maintenance and to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
To make a living, Esther owns and operates a general store in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for eight years and she earns well from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She always finds ways to improve her business in order to gain more profit.

Currently she took a new loan from GDMPC microfinance to purchase more grocery goods to sell. Esther plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: To make a living, Susan helps her husband working on their own farm. She has been doing this for many years as their main source of income and she was able to provide for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for fertilizer. Currently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to purchase a new variety of seeds and organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: To make a living, Nena operates a farm and at the same time has a swine fattening business. She has been doing this for more than six years and she earns good enough for their daily living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for feeding supplies. To improve her business, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy an adult female hog to be able to sell piglets in the future. Nena wants to expand her piggery and to be able to earn more income to repair their house.

loans.use: to buy an adult female hog

loans.name: Randy

texts.en: Randy is single and has a business while he works as a teacher. He also has a part time job as a tutor in a private school. Randy needs to review for the coming license examination. Without hesitation, he joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to finance the cost of his review. He is hopeful of having a better career in the future and being able to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to finance the cost of his review for the coming license examination

loans.name: Carmena

texts.en: To make a living. Carmena sells dried fish in their village. For many years in the business, she earns well and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. Currently, she took a new loan to purchase additional dried fish to sell. In the future, Carmena wants to build a house and have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish

loans.name: Arwen

texts.en: To make a living, Arwen operates a farm while working in a private company. He has been farming for three years and he earns well from this. He joined GDMPC in 2013 and has taken out a new loan to buy additional fertilizer to improve the farm. He hopes to gain more profit to use for improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: To make a living, Helen manages a retail business in her village. She has been in the business for six years earning well for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in purchasing additional goods. Helen always finds ways to improve the business and recently took out a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: To make a living, Crisanta operates a retail store while her husband fishes. She has been selling grocery goods in their village for seven years and she earns enough for their daily needs. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used to purchase more products to sell. Crisanta find ways to augment their living. She took a new loan from GDMPN microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en: To make a living, Aiza has helped her live-in partner in their transportation business for three years now. She earns well from this aside from her income from employment as a factory worker. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy new tires. She plans to buy another motorcycle to be used for business expansion. In the future, she wants to settle down to live with a happy family.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: To make a living, Elena helps her husband working in their rice farm. She has six children who have helped her in farmwork during leisure times or when they have no classes and jobs to attend to. Her spouse is a carpenter but his job is not permanent so they are both engaged in farming to help the family. She makes a good living from this and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm irrigation and fertilization. Currently, she took out a new loan to purchase fertilizer. Elena wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: To make a living, Marcelina helps her husband in the farm while raising pigs to sell. She earns a good living from this and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for their farm and to buy feed. Currently, she took a new loan to purchase feed and additional piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and and additional piglets.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en: Manilyn is studying for a BS in Business Administration at Stella Maris College. Her parents make a living through a business. She joined Gata Daku MPC, and she gains access to all their financial services. She had a previous loan used for the first semester tuition fees. Currently, she took a new loan to pay the school tuition fees on her second semester. She wants to be a successful woman and has a passion to finish her course of study and be able to get a job in order to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for her second semester

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is married with two children and operates a charcoal making business to make a living. She also buys coconuts to  make copra and and charcoal. She sells it in town and earns well for the family. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional coconuts and coco shells. She find ways to improve her business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional coconuts and coco shells

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en: Fausta is married to a carpenter, and she had an only child. To make a living, she personally manages their own farm, while her husband does carpentry. She grows and harvests coconuts and earns well from this. To improve the farm, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy fertilizer. She hopes to improve the farm to have a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married with five adult children. She is earning with her retailing business, while her husband earns from their own farm. 

She has been selling assorted goods for many years, and she earns enough for their daily needs. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy more goods like biscuits, pastries and candies to sell. 

She finds ways to improve her business to earn more for the family. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goods like biscuits, pastries and candies to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is married to a fisherman. To make a living, she operates a general store in their village while her husband does fishing. To improve the business, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy groceries to sell. She finds ways to improve her business to earn more for the family. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for sale.

loans.name: Merychel

texts.en:
Merychel is married with an only child. She operates a piggery business while her husband does farming. She has been raising pigs to sell for eight years and she earns well for the family. 

She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy feed in order to boost her pigs. In the future, she plans to expand her shelter and improve her business. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a single entrepreneur who manages a buy-and-sell business, selling Avon cosmetic products in her local community. She used her motorcycle to deliver items and collect payments from her customers. She has been earning a living through this business for more than a year. 

Jenalyn joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and borrowed a loan to cover the cost of motor maintenance, new tires, and repairs. She was determined to double the effort exerted, to improve and expand the business for a better future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of motor maintenance, new tires, and repairs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: To make a living, Helen helps her husband operate their own farm. Early in the morning, her husband does fishing and after this, the couple work growing and harvesting vegetables, and they earns well from this. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying fertilizer.  Currently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional organic fertilizer to improve the farm. She wants to ensure a better source of income by improving and expanding the existing farm. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is a single entrepreneur who buys and sells fruit to make a living. He has been doing this for twenty years and he earns well from this.

Rolly find ways to improve his business to save for the planned expansion of business. He joined GDMPC and took a loan to buy more fruits to sell.

He is determined is to improve and expand his business to have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Yman Jayzer

texts.en: To make a living, Yman Jazer operates a service-based business providing motorcycle transport in his community. It is his main source of income and he earns well from this so he is able to support his parents. Currently, he is taking a new loan to buy tires and pay for repair costs. He plans to purchase additional vehicles for his transport business from the revenue generated.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for repair costs

loans.name: Elgena

texts.en: To make a living, Elgena owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting coconuts. She has been in this business for more than twenty years and she earns well from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs. Aside from her farm, she manages a retail business selling molded clay products in their village. Currently, she is requesting a new loan to buy additional clay products to sell. In the future, her plan is to save her profits in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy additional clay products to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: To make a living, Cecilia operates a cafeteria in their village. She has been in this business for nine years and she earns well from this. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying additional viands, soft drinks, etc. In order to gain more profit, she is requesting a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase raw ingredients and new food containers. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her business and living situation.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and new food containers

loans.name: Eumerson

texts.en: Eumerson dreams of finishing his studies in order to have a better future. He is studying Information Technology Programming  at C-LAN Institute of Technology. His father earns money from farming, but having three siblings to support is not easy. He helps his parents by working in their farm for a living. To pay the school tuition fees for the second semester this current year, Eumerson joined GDMPC and borrowed an education loan, one of the services for GDMPC members. He is thankful to the cooperative for making his ambition possible.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en: Catalino is married and has four school aged children. His wife earns income with her eatery services, Catalino operates a tailoring business to make a living. For ten years of doing the business, he earns well to support the family. To improve the business, he joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance services and currently borrowed a new loan to buy fabrics and threads to cater to made to order products. He is hopeful of improving the business in order to provide a better living for his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: To make a living, Marife helps her husband operates their own farm. Aside from this, she also sells snacks and barbecue in their village to earn additional income. She successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC that she used for farm inputs. Now, she is availing another loan in order to to purchase organic fertilizer for the next cropping. She is hopeful that she will gain more profits from their farm and from her business to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anna Fe

texts.en: Anna Fe is married and she helps her husband work on their farm to make a living. She helps him harvest coconuts and sell them in town. The couple earns well from their farm. Anna Fe joined GDMPC  and borrowed a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She was determined to improve the farm in order to secure the income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is married and has three children.  She helps her husband operate their own farm for a living. For the past five years, the couple has earned enough income for the family. She's always finding ways to improve the farm. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer to boost the farm.  In the future, she wants to become successful through farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rorelyn

texts.en:
Rorelyn is married with an only child. To make a living, she sells food and snacks in their village and she earns well for their daily needs aside from her husband's income from working. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy additional goods and snacks to sell. 

She plans to build a shelter for her merchandise in order to store more goods and to earn more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods and snacks to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is married with an only child. She operates a general store in their village, selling different types of goods to make a living. She earns well from this. She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Claire Ann

texts.en: Claire Ann is married with an only child. She operates a general store in their village to make a living. She has been in this business for five years and she earns well from this. She joined GDMPC and took out a loan to buy more grocery items to sell. In the future, she hopes to have a stable source of income with this line of business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa is married with two children. She operates a general store in their village to make a living. Having been in the business for ten years, Marisa earns well and is able to support her children's needs. She joined GDMPC and has taken out a loan to purchase rice and corn grits to sell in addition to her other offerings. She wants to improve and expand the business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Benjamen

texts.en:
Benjamen is married with four children. To earn a living, he operates a service-based business providing transportation in the community. He earns well from this and has been in this business for six years. He is able to provide for the family and his children's needs. 

He borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to pay for his children's college tuition fees. He is determined and hopeful to see his children become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay his children's tuition fees

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married with four children. To make a living, she operates a general store selling grocery goods in their village. 

She has been in this business for five years and earns well for the family. She used the profits to send her children to school. 

She borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She had to expand and improve her business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Elgie

texts.en:
Elgie is a daughter of a farmer who earns a living raising crops on his own farm. Having seven siblings is not easy to handle. It is a challenge for the entire family to help one another in order to improve their living. 

Elgie studies Information Technology at C-LAN Institute of Technology in Mindanao. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and borrowed a new loan to pay for the school tuition fees for the second semester this year. 

She hopes to have a better career so she will be able to support her family in the near future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
To make a living, Lourdes operates a general store in their village selling different kinds of grocery goods. She has been doing this for many years and she earns well from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in the business. 

Currently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.  Lourdes hopes that her business will be  progressive. In the future, Lourdes will use her income to support her two children in their studies until they finish college and also support them with their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Edgar Sr.

texts.en:
To make a living, Edgar operates a service business, providing motor transportation in his community. He also has a job working as a security guard, for a private company. He earns well from these activities, and he has successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used for motor repairs.

Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC. He used this new loan to buy tires. From many years of use, the unit needed tire replacement for better and safe services. He plans to purchase another unit of motorcycle later, for expansion of the business.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Hedjara

texts.en:
To make a living, Hedjara helps her husband to operate a service business, providing motor transportation in their community. In addition to this, the couple has a farm, which is their main source of income.

Hedjara successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to buy new tires for the existing motorcycle unit. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC. She will use this new loan to purchase fertilizer, in order to improve the farm. She saves her income, to be used for home improvement in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda earns an income by operating a grocery store in her village. She has been selling assorted grocery items from her store for the past 15 years and makes a good living from her business.

Erlinda has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to improve her business. She is requesting a new loan from GDMPC in order to purchase school supplies to offer for sale in her store. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
To make a living, Benson operates a service based business providing motor transportation in his community. He earns well from this and was able to support his family and his two children. He successfully repaid his previous loan which he used for motor repair. 

Currently, Benson took a new loan to purchase a new set of tires in order to replace the existing motor tires. In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house, and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married, with two children. She raises pigs to sell while her husband does farming to make a living. She has been doing this for five years and it helps to sustain their living. 

Alma borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy additional piglets to raise. Alma uses most of her time to help her husband on the farm and to take care of other livestock, specially raising pigs, in order to augment their situation. 

She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Elgin

texts.en:
Elgin is married with two children. She operates their own farm while her husband works in a private company to make a living. She grows and harvests coconuts and bananas while raising vegetables in their little garden too. She earns well from this. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm. She wants to have a greener farm to earn more income in return.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
To make a living, Marina is involved in farming and raising pigs for sale. She has been doing this for more than six years and she earns well from this. 

She borrowed a new loan to buy additional piglets to raise. She plans to build shelter for the pigs and to use it for business expansion. Marina wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
To make a living, Helen raises pigs while her husband does farming. She has been doing this for many years and it helps a lot in sustaining their daily needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used in in her pig business. 

She plans to expand her business and without hesitation, she took a new loan to build a shelter for her pigs. She wants to live better and be comfortable in the remaining days of her life with her family.

loans.use: to build a shelter for pigs.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is married with an only child. She operates a motorcycle transportation business while her husband works at a private company to make a living. She earns well from this to meet their necessities. She joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance services. She borrowed a new loan to repair her existing motorcycle and buy tires. She is hoping to have a better source of income for the family to improve their living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle and buy tires

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
To make a living, Myrna helps her husband work on their own farm. The couple grows and harvests crops, and they earn well for the family. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs. She always finds ways to have a greener farm, to earn more income in return. 

Currently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. 

She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: To make a living, Matilde operates a resale business in her village. Over many years in clothing sales, she has earned a decent income and successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to obtain more clothes. Aside from this business, she is engaged in the manufacturing business of weaving and selling lampakanay products. She earns a better income from this business. Currently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional lampakanay leaves and woven products to resell.  Matilde still hopes that her business will continue to progress.

loans.use: to buy additional lampakanay leaves and woven products to resell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
To make a living, Veronica operates a cafeteria in their village, and she earns well from this. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She found ways to improve the business and cater other services in order to gain more income in return. 

Without hesitation, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase additional raw ingredients and new kitchen utensils to be used.  

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients and new kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Mailah

texts.en:
Mailah is studying for her Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration at Aurora Pioneers Memorial College. Her father works as a carpenter and having eight children is quite a difficult task for her parents. Instead, they were both determined to provide the children with a better future. 

In her way of helping them, Mailah joined GDMPC and took a loan to pay for her school tuition fees for the second semester this current year. She hopes to find a better career in the future to help the family augment their living situation.

loans.use: to pay for school tuition fees

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
To make a living, Erma operates a service-based business, providing sewing of different kinds of clothing and curtains. She also does made-to-order products. She earns well from the business and she had successfully repaid her previous loan, used to buy materials for the business. 

Currently, Erma borrowed a new loan to purchase additional fabrics and new spare parts for the repair of her existing machine. 

In the future, Erma wants to make improvements to her house and also to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and new spare parts for the repair of existing machine

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is single and is living with her family. To make a living, she raises pigs and sell them in town. She earns well from this and she needs to expand the business to gain more returns. 

She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy feed. She plans to build a shelter for her pigs to be used for expansion. She hopes to gain more profit to use for her future needs.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is married with four children. She helps her husband in their manufacturing business, making and selling woven bamboo panels to make a living. She has been in this business for more than seven years and the couple earns well for the family.

In order to improve their earnings, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more woven bamboo panels to resell. She is hopeful that they will improve their business and live a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more woven bamboo panels to resell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is married with two children. She helps her husband in their manufacturing business weaving and selling woven bamboo panels to make a living. For the ten years they have been in the business, the couple have earned enough to sustain their daily living. She find ways to augment their business to gain more in return. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to to buy more woven bamboo panels to resell. She plans to engage in selling her products in town to gain more profit for the family.

loans.use: to buy more woven bamboo panels to resell.

loans.name: Odesa

texts.en:
Odesa is married with three children. She helps her husband operate their own farm for a living. She has been growing pigs many years and she earns well to sustain the family's daily needs. 

She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to purchase feed and repair the pigs' shelter. She hopes to find ways to augment her family's  living and plans to expand her piggery business to earn more in return. She hopes to have a better living in the the near future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and repair the pigs' shelter

loans.name: Mudz

texts.en:
Mudz is married and has three children.  He is engaged in retailing a hypo stain remover product in his community in order to make a living.  For five years, he has earned well from this business.  

He has borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more hypo stain remover to sell in the neighboring village.  He hopes to have a stall in the market in town where he can sell his product.  Mudz wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy hypo stain remover.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: To make a living, Nena manages her general store and she earns well from this. She has successfully repaid her previous loans used for business improvement. Currently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. Nena needs to expand her business offerings to gain more in return. She is determined enough to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a widow with four children. She operates a hog raising business to make a living. For ten years of doing this, she was able to provide the needs of her children and even send them to school. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feed. She wants to improve and sustain the business in order to gain more return for the family's living. She is determined to improve the general situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is married with three children and operates a food production business specializing in suman. She has been vending suman for ten years and she earns well from this to provide for her family. To meet orders and demand, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional raw ingredients for preparing suman. She is humble to say that even in a little way of business, she can earn enough to make a living with her husband and the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for preparing suman to sell

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is married and has four children. She operates a general store while her husband works in their village as a laborer. She has been running her business for ten years and she earns well for the family. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family and would like to see her children successful.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with six children and helps her husband in their little farm to make a living. She has been selling assorted vegetables harvested from their field for more than ten years and she earns well enough to support the family.

 She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to   buy seeds and organic fertilizer.

 In the future, she wants to improve their farm to ensure a better income for the family.

loans.use: to  buy seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a widow who earns a living with her gardening business. She has been growing and harvesting vegetables for more than six years and she earns well from this. Aside from this, she also engages in vending snacks in the village to earn more income.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy seeds and fertilizer in order to gain more returns from her garden. 

In the future, she wants to sustain her farm to ensure a better source of income for her future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with five children.  She operates a retail store in their village to make a living. Her husband earns from a transportation business being a driver. She has been selling grocery items for twenty years earning well for her to provide for her family.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She joined GDMPC last year to earn access to micro finance services.

She wants to see her children have a successful career and have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel had eight children with her live-in partner. She operates a general store while her partner runs a service based business providing arts and signs in their village. She has been in her business for more than five years and she earns well from this.

She joined GDMPC in 2013 and borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods for sale. She wants to ensure that the business will be sustainable to earn more income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for sale

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
To make a living, Joel operates a farm planting and harvesting rice for sale. For ten years , he earns well to provide the family and had successfully repay his previous loan used for farm inputs.

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to purchase seedling and weeding maintenance cost

In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family and to purchase additional farmland.

loans.use: to purchase seedling and weeding maintenance cost

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is widowed with four children who operates a general store to make a living. She has been doing this for ten years and she earns well from this.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy more grocery goods to sell. Her determination in improving the business make things and her daily tasks easier. She personally oversees her business.

In the future, she wants to sustain and improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson is a single entrepreneur who has managed a cafeteria and a general store for ten years. He earns well from this and it helps him a lot to make a living. He has also hired some employees to help him in his business.

To improve his business, he has taken a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase raw ingredients and additional grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, Jason wants to improve the general living situation of his family as well as his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is married with three children and operates a general store to make a living. He has been in this business for 20 years and he earns well from this to provide for his family. 

He joined GDMPC in 2013 and has now taken a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell in order to improve his store. Ernesto wants to improve the general living situation of his family and hopes to sustain his business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Mark Khem

texts.en:
To make a living, Mark Khem, a young entrepreneur, runs a wholesale and retail store selling dry goods. For more than five years in the business, he has earned well from this and has successfully repaid his previous loan used for the business. 

Currently, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy additional goods like slippers, plastic wares, and RTW (Ready-To-Wear).

He plans to expand his business and is hopeful to have an improved living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like slippers, plastic wares and RTW (Ready-To-Wear).

loans.name: Resma

texts.en:
To make a living, Resma helps her husband by working on their own farm. She successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that was used for the farm. She earned well from their farm’s last crop.

Currently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer needed for the next crop season. 

In the future, she wants to have an improved farm for a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is studying AB - Mass Communication at a university in Mindanao. Her mother died soon after she was born and her father earns a living by preparing roasted pigs to sell. She recently began living with her grandparents.

Erika joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to pay school tuition fees for her second semester. She wants to have a better career in the future in order to help those who supported her in her younger age.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for her second semester

loans.name: Carenette

texts.en:
To make a living, Carenette has been working as a branch manager of an appliance store for more than seven years. She also had a service-based business that provides printing services. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying a computer. 

Currently, she borrowed a new loan to cover the costs for maintenance of the existing computer.

She always dreams of being successful in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs for maintenance of the existing computer

loans.name: Jelar

texts.en:
To make a living, Jelar helps her husband by tending their farm and harvesting corn for sale. Aside from this, she also sells barbecued food in their village to earn additional income. 

Jelar had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs. Currently, she has taken a new loan from GDMPC to buy raw ingredients, and a portion will be used for fertilization of the farm.

She plans to cultivate the unused land on their farm in order to earn more income for the future of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and fertilizer

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
To make a living, Sarah sells used products such as ready-to-wear clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, lotions and many other products while her husband does fishing. For eleven years in the business, Sarah earns well to provide for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for her cosmetics selling business. 

Currently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new fishing nets and hooks for their fishing business.

Sarah plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
To make a living, Maricel runs a general store in their village, while her husband works in a private company. For more than two years in the business, Maricel earns well to improve the business. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying additional goods.

Currently, she took a new loan from GDMPC  micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

She plans to save a portion of her income as a reserve for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
To make a living, Nenita buys and sells rice and has done so for many years. She earns enough to provide her family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business.

Currently, she is taking out a new loan to buy more rice products to retail. She was determined to improve her business and plans to have a milling business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice products to sell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
To make a living, Rosalina has been selling fish in the market for ten years. She earns enough from this to provide her family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She gained access to micro finance services after she joined GDMPC. 

Currently, she is taking out a new loan to purchase additional volumes of fish to sell. She is hopeful that with this capital, she would earn more profits. 

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional volumes of fish

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
To make a living, Brenda sells fish in the market while her husband does fishing. For more than 12 years, she has been earning well enough to provide for her family and successfully repay her previous loan used in the business. 

Recently she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase an additional volume of fish to sell.

In the future, Brenda wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: To make a living, Elsa sells fish in the market and she has been doing this for many years. She earns well from the business and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. Currently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional fish to sell. With this additional capital, it is sure for Elsa to gain more profit. She has no other wants than to see her family be comfortable and improve their living.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
To make a living, Jocelyn has multiple businesses like growing crabs and fish and a general store. With this business, she earns enough for her to provide for her family. She successfully repaid her previous loan which she used in her store to purchase goods to sell.  

She requested a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She is hopeful to earn more income for her family. She wants to improve her family's general living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Nikko James

texts.en:
Nikko James is studying a Basic Seaman Training Course at University in Zamboanga del Sur. His parents earn from their salary as government employees and have three dependents so education costs are not easy. Nikko James feels that  his parents need money so he joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to pay his school tuition fees. He dreams of having a better career in order to support his family.

Each semester, GDMPC allows borrowers to take out two loans. This is one of the two loans for Nikko.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Alejo

texts.en:
To make a living, Alejo operates a service-based business, providing transportation services in his community. During the eight years he has been in the business, he has earned well for the family and has successfully repaid his previous loan which was used to purchase tires. 

Currently, he took a new loan to cover the costs for repairs and maintenance. 

In the future, Alejo hopes to purchase additional motorcycles for his business.

loans.use: to cover the costs for repairs and maintenance.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo provides transportation services in his community while his wife operates a general store to make a living. For the five years they have been running the business, the couple has earned well and were able to provide for the family needs. 

Alfredo joined GDMPC in 2013 and had took a new loan to buy new tires to replace the existing ones so as to give better services. He also used his motorcycle to carry goods for the store.

Alfredo wants to have a comfortable and better standard of living for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
To make a living, Amelia helps her husband working on their own farm. She has been doing this for five years earning well for the family and successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm chemicals. Farming is their main source of income which is why the couple endeavored to improve the farm. 

Currently, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer to be used for this cropping season. 

In the future, Amelia's plan is to save her returns in order to improve their house.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

location.town: La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
To make a living, Elvie helps her husband on their farm as well as operating a general store. She earns well from her doings to provide for her family and she had successfully repaid her previous loan used for purchasing goods. 

Currently, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm. She makes sure to improve their farm to ensure a better harvest. 

She plans to use the additional revenue to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
To make a living, Evangeline helps her husband managing their banana farm. She earns well from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the farm. She always finds ways to obtain a better source of income.

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings. She thinks that with this loan, she will be able to sustain the farm and improve it to gain more returns. 

She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa earns a living from her gardening business. She sells fresh vegetables in their village and also sells ready-to-plant seedlings. She earns well from this to provide her daily needs and she also harvests coconut. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional seeds and fertilizer. 

In the future, she wants to expand her farm and wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
To make a living, Julieta manages her own farm of coconut and banana in their village. She earns well from this to provide her family and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for fertilizer. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer and cover maintenance costs of her farm. She always find ways in order to augment their living.

In the future, Julieta wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family  and wants to cultivate her farm and be able to generate more income to ensure a better life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cover maintenance costs of her farm

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marrisa is married and has operated a general store for five years to make a living. She earns well to provide for her family. In order to improve the business, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. Marrisa is hopeful enough to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en: Merlie is married and helps her husband working in their own farm to make a living. For five years in this business, she earns well for the family. Merlie borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer. She always finds ways to improve the farm to gain more returns. In the future, Merlie hopes to improve the farm and wants to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad operates a general store, while her husband is farming to make a living. For more than five years, she has been earning well from this to provide for her family. With the help of her husband, their plans of improving and expanding the business can be obtained. The couple is determined to augment their business to ensure a better source of income.

Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional stock, such as grocery goods, to sell. 

She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as  grocery goods, to sell.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
To make a living, Warlita operates a buy-and-sell business selling woven nipa palm mats in their village while her husband does farming. She earns well from this business and successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for the business. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy more nipa palm leaves and more woven palm mats to resell. It is her way to cater for orders and demand for woven nipa. 

She has planned to save a portion of her income for the future needs of the family. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more nipa palm leaves and more woven palm mats to resell

loans.name: Necifora

texts.en:
Necifora is married and helps her husband working on their own farm to make a living. She has been doing this for thirteen years and she earns well for the family. 

She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer in order to improve the farm. Necifora wants to improve their farm and the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia is married with four children. She operates a general store while her husband does farming. For twelve years in the business, she was able to provide for her family and helps to finance their farm as well. Recently, she borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She always hopes to improve her business to gain more returns and improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Crizza Pearl

texts.en:
Crizza Pearl wants to be a teacher in the future. She is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education degree in a university.  Her parents earn a living from farming and sending her to school is their passion. 

To help lighten her parents' financial needs, Crizza Pearl joined GDMPC to gain access to microfinance services. She requested a loan, which she will use to pay school tuition fees for the current semester. She hopes to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Lyna

texts.en:
Lyna is married with three children. She operates a general store, while her husband earns money from working as driver. She has been running the business for awhile, and she earned enough money at first, but due to a lack of ability to engage business, she was unable to progress. 

She joined GDMPC in 2012 and it has helped to improve her ability to be an entrepreneur. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase grocery goods to restock her store. She is hopeful to sustain her business to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to restock her store

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is married with three children. She helps her husband operating their own farm to make a living. For thirteen years, the couple have earned well for the family. 

She needed to improve and expand the farm. She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides. She hopes to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is widow with two children. She manages a general store while taking care of her female hog. For the eight years she has been in the business, she has earned well enough to provide for their needs. 

She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy feed in order to boost her female hogs. She was happy because she earned well this time from selling piglets. She hopes to improve her business and be able to build a shelter for her pigs for expansion.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
To make a living, Merlinda operates a general store while her husband does farming. She has been in business for more than three years, and she earns enough to meet their daily needs. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in her business. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She was determined to augment her business. With the help of GDMPC, she was able to improve her ability to engage in her business.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be able to save a portion of her earnings for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
To make a living, Dinah operates a general store in their village. For more than nine years in the business, she earns well to provide for her family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for additional capital for the store. 

Currently, Dinah has borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
To make a living, Jessica operates a general store while her husband works in a private company. She earns well from her business and is able to provide her family's daily needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used to purchase goods for resale.

Currently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to expand her business and to be able to renovate their house to have better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
To make a living, Raquel operates a general store in their village, while her husband does farming. She has run the business for more than four years, and she earns enough to provide for her family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business.

Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. Improving her store is her great passion to ensure a better source of income.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jenith

texts.en:
To make a living, Jenith has been selling fruits in her village for twelve years. She earns well from this and was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She used the previous loan to improve her business. She always find ways to augment her living through a business venture.

Currently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more variety of fruits to sell. 

It is her passion to have a business in order to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Colita

texts.en:
Colita is married and has three children. She offers laundry services in their village and earns well from this service. Colita's husband works as a carpenter and the couple is able to provide for the family's needs. 

Colita joined GDMPC in 2013 and she gained access to microfinance services. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to cover the costs of house repairs. The couple wants to provide the family with a comfortable and better life in the future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of house repairs

loans.name: Charie

texts.en: This 33-year-old woman from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental is called Charie. She is the wife of a driver, a mother of three and has a passion for her family. She has a pig shed next to her home where she keeps her pigs. Charie has decided to start a piggery business and to turn her hobby into a business. Of course her family will help her to buy and sell the livestock, but she will take care of them herself. Since her capital is not enough to open such a business, she needs a loan. She is requesting a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feed for her pigs. She is looking forward to a change in their living situation and to progress in the business she has started.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo has been running a service-based business, providing transportation services to the local community, and he earns well to provide for his family. He successfully repaid his previous loan used for maintenance of and improvements to the vehicle. 

Currently, he has taken a new loan to buy new tires for his existing motorcycle with sidecar.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his existing motorcycle with sidecar

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Aged 50, Avelina is a married mother of an only child living in the village in Tangub City. Banana farming is their main source of income. For many years in farming, the couple has earned well to provide for the family and Avelina has completely paid back her previous loan used for the farm.

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy organic fertilizer for this cropping season.  She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her farming business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for this cropping season.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a widow who operates a general store which she has been running for many years, earning well to provide for her family. With her determination to have a better income, she always finds ways to augment the business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business.

Currently, she has taken a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods and other supplies to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes has been operating a retail business for many years while her husband operated a tailoring business and the couple earns well from this. She has paid back her previous loan as she earns a better income currently. She used her previous loan as additional capital for her business. Recently, she requested a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional beauty products and ladies accessories to sell. She plans to build a store where she can better operate her business. She wants to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products and ladies accessories to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been operating a general store in their village to make a living. For many years in the business, Daniel has been earning well to provide for his family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used for business capital. Daniel wants the best for the family and his children as well.

Currently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery items and supplies to merchandise. He wants his family to have better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items and supplies to merchandise

loans.name: Dayriel

texts.en:
Dayriel is studying information technology in a university in Misamis Occidental. He has a part time job in one of the photo studios in town. He has eight siblings and his parents who earn their wages from laboring which is not easy to handle. But he never felt discouraged despite financial problems. He wants to enroll but having to pay a high tuition is quite hard to do since his financial situation will not allow him to do so.

He joined GDMPC and took a loan to pay school tuition fees for the second semester this school year.  In the future, Dayriel  wants to study and eventually earn a professional degree.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is an experienced farmer who owns a cow and cultivates land. She cultivates the land for cocoa and corn, selling the harvest in the local market. Nonetheless, Catherine hasn't been able to save enough money to care for the needs of her family and, at the same time, to cover the upkeep of her farm. 

Catherine has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. Realizing the importance of the income that she gathers from agribusiness, the loan will greatly assist Catherine to enlarge her farm and ensure a better life for her family. She will be very grateful to GDMPC for lending the capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 40-year-old married mother of four helping her husband operate their own farm to make a living. For more than five years in farming, the couple has earned well to provide the needs of the family. Realizing the importance of her ambition of having her children finish their studies, their loan is greatly assisting them to improve their farm.

Marissa took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm.
